comments.author: Amisha
comments.content: This sounds yummy.  What can I substitute for the eggs as we don't eat eggs, not vegan but no eggs.  Thanks so much, Amisha.

comments.author: nancy
comments.content: Love black rice.  Looking forward to trying this recipe.  I am one of those people who is not too fond of cilantro.  Do you think if i substituted basil or tarragon with the cilantro it woud taste good with this dish?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Amisha -

I haven't tried, but you could give something like N-R-G brand egg replacer a go. If you do, let me know how it works out.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: For the chimichurri, if I didn't want to use cilantro, I'd just use double the parsley, or mostly parsley and a little fresh oregano.

comments.author: Donna
comments.content: Sigh, I know you put the capers and cilantro in your chimichurri but those items are really not used in Argentina for Chimichurri. My family there does not ever use cilantro. Or capers! Some of them will add the oregano if they have it and crushed red pepper is a must. That being said, I am going to try this with brown rice because I have it!  Then I will look for black rice.

comments.author: Amisha
comments.content: Thanks.  EnerG is great for baking.  I'm trying to figure out what else will bind.  I'm guessing that's what the egg is used for.

comments.author: emmycooks
comments.content: Gorgeous!  I love rice cakes cooked like this--it's our favorite use of Little Uncle leftovers (we mix the leftover sauce in too before frying).  The colors and flavors here are so lovely, I'm looking forward to mixing up the latke tradition with these this year!  The other Hanukkah meal I make annually is this decadent french toast: http://www.nytimes.com/2009/12/09/dining/091arex.html?ref=dining :)

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Oooh, that French toast looks terrific.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Donna - you are absolutely right that I take some liberties with the name chimichurri!

comments.author: Sara @ The Cozy Herbivore
comments.content: Yum! I'm also a huge fan of smoked paprika for that extra umani-boost in veggie dishes. These look so yummy-- who can resist fritters? And the chimichurri to brighten everything up... I can't wait to give these babies a whirl!

comments.author: jodye @ chocolate and chou fleur
comments.content: These fritters look like a lovely alternative to the requisite latkes that are so abundant during hannukah. Do you think flax or chia gel would work as well as eggs as a binder? Or perhaps some mashed black beans. Looks like I have some experimenting to do!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: You know, I just don't have enough experience with alternative binders in situations like this to have an opinion. If you try one, please let us know how it turns out.

comments.author: anju
comments.content: can i use brown rice instead of black rice as black rice is not available in our place ?

comments.content: Totally making these next week.  They seem tastey but LOOK beautiful as well.
